title_sort: will williams to walt whitman, 31 may 1875
title: Will Williams to Walt Whitman, 31 May 1875
text: THE PICTORIAL WORLD,Illustrated Newspaper,OFFICES: 63, FLEET STREET, LONDON.May 31st 1875.Walt Whitman Esq.Dear Sir,As one of your admirers, and as this comes of Mr. Robert Buchanan, another of your admirers, I want you to do me a favor—that is, to write me a lyric—something in the style of that on Abraham Lincoln—for a new monthly magazine I am about to bring out. Will you do this?As a further clue to my identity, I may tell you that I am editor of this paper and English correspondent of Appleton's Journal.Very faithfully yours,Will Williams.P.S. The magazine in question will contain contributions of well-known English and American authors. Will Williams to Walt Whitman, 31 May 1875
